jx.jx_en_mean: an act of vesting the legislative, executive, and judiciary powers of government in separate bodies

means.word_mean: 间隔,区分,分裂,撤销,断绝

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: via Old French from Latin separatio(n-), from separare 'disjoin, divide' (see separate)

entry.def: The separation of two or more things or groups is the fact that they are separate or become separate, and are not linked.

example.ex: He believes in the separation of the races.
example.tran: 他认为应该实施种族隔离。

example.ex: ...a 'Christian republic' in which there was a clear separation between church and state.
example.tran: 政教彻底分离的“基督教共和国”

entry.def: During a separation, people who usually live together are not together.

example.ex: She wondered if Harry had been unfaithful to her during this long separation...
example.tran: 她不知道和哈里分开这么久,他是否曾对她不忠。

example.ex: All children will tend to suffer from separation from their parents and siblings.
example.tran: 所有的孩子和他们的父母及兄弟姐妹分开后往往都会难过。

entry.def: If a couple who are married or living together have a separation, they decide to live apart.

example.ex: They agreed to a trial separation.
...loss of a loved one through death, separation or divorce.
example.tran: 因死亡、分居或离婚而失去了心爱的人

Sentence.sentence: Today, given the job losses of the past year, fewer unhappy couples will risk starting separate households, Furthermore, the housing market meltdown will make it more difficult for them to finance their separations by selling their homes.
What's less clear is whether divorce and separation rates rise in a recession - financial pressures mean couples argue more but make splitting up less affordable.

sentences.en: After a long separation,they held a glad meeting.
sentences.cn: 阔别多年之后,他们举行了一个令人愉快的聚会。

sentences.en: She is visiting her family after a long separation.
sentences.cn: 她正在探望久别的家人。

sentences.en: Separation from her friends made her very sad.
sentences.cn: 与朋友分别使她很伤心。

sentences.en: Couples may agree to divorce each other after a separation.
sentences.cn: 分居后,夫妇可能会同意离婚。

sentences.en: The separation is by mutual agreement.
The couple agreed on a trial separation.
sentences.cn: 这对夫妻同意试验性分居。
